actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to relieve small employers from the requirement of paying or depositing certain employment taxes more often than once each month.

summary.text: Provides, under the Internal Revenue Code, that in the case of an employer whose withholding taxes and taxes on wages paid by employers does not exceed $16,000, the old age, survivors', and disability insurance, and Federal income tax withholding payments shall not be required more than once each month. (Adds 26 U.S.C. 6302(d))

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to relieve small employers from the requirement of paying or depositing certain employment taxes more often than once each month.
